title: Definitions
context: ยง321-342 Definitions. As used in this part: &ldquo;Child&rdquo; means a person under eighteen years of age. &ldquo;Child death review information&rdquo; means information regarding the child and child&rsquo;s family, including but not limited to: (1) Social, medical, and legal histories; (2) Death and birth certificates; (3) Law enforcement investigative data; (4) Medical examiner or coroner investigative data; (5) Parole and probation information and records; (6) Information and records of social service agencies; (7) Educational records; and (8) Health care institution information. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of health. &ldquo;Director&rdquo; means the director of health or the director&rsquo;s designated representatives. &ldquo;Family&rdquo; means: (1) Each legal parent; (2) The natural mother; (3) The natural father; (4) The adjudicated, presumed, or concerned natural father as defined under section 578-2; (5) Each parent&rsquo;s spouse or former spouses; (6) Each sibling or person related by consanguinity or marriage; (7) Each person residing in the same dwelling unit; and (8) Any other person who, or legal entity that, is a child&rsquo;s legal or physical custodian or guardian, or who is otherwise responsible for the child&rsquo;s care, other than an authorized agency that assumes such a legal status or relationship with the child under chapter 587A. &ldquo;Preventable death&rdquo; means a death that reasonable medical, social, legal, psychological, or educational intervention may have prevented. &ldquo;Provider of medical care&rdquo; means any health care practitioner who provides, or a facility through which is provided, any medical evaluation or treatment, including dental and mental health evaluation or treatment. [L 1997, c 369, pt of ยง1; am L 2010, c 135, ยง7]
